summary: This is a cover email from attorney Nicole Simmons submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to motions to quash her subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to Judge Nathan. The filing is being submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who is submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's court filing to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the case U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to whom the filing is addressed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney who requested that Nicole Simmons submit the filing on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the case U.S. v. Maxwell, whose response to motions to quash her subpoena is being submitted.

connections.description: Nicole Simmons is submitting a legal filing on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jeffrey Pagliuca requested the submission of Maxwell's legal response, indicating he is part of her defense team.
Both are attorneys working on Ghislaine Maxwell's defense, with Pagliuca requesting Simmons to submit the filing.

events.title: Submission of Maxwell's Response to Motions to Quash
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team submits her response to motions to quash her Rule 17(c) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was actively fighting to obtain information from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program via a Rule 17(c) subpoena.
The filing was submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions, indicating sensitive content.
The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in U.S. v. Maxwell (Case No. 20 Cr. 330) as of November 2021.
The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was a target of Maxwell's subpoena, suggesting her defense sought information about victims or claims.
